intro: Celsia pontica, commonly known as the Pontic celsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the regions of the Caucasus and southern Europe, where it thrives in moist, forested environments. The plant features compound leaves with a distinct pinnate structure and produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Celsia pontica is characterized by its delicate appearance and ecological significance in its native habitats.
